sentences.sContent: an area with a high incidence of crime
...What did James Burke recommend to reduce the incidence of cognitive decline...
...we can reduce the incidence of cognitive decline...
...The incidence of teenage crime and misbehavior is decreasing nowadays...
...writing breathlessly in the New York Times about the "rising incidence of extreme events"...
...hurricane incidence has dropped off the charts...

exam.question: At present, it is not possible to confirm or to refute the suggestion that there is a causal relationship between the amount of fat we eat and the______ of heart attacks.

answer.explain: 句意： 有人认为， 脂肪的摄入量和心脏病发病率之间存在着因果关系， 但现在我们很难决定应该赞成还是反驳这种观点。impetus： 推动力， 促进； rupture： 破裂， 决裂； emergence： 浮现， 露出。

synos.tran: 发生率；影响；[光]入射；影响范围

phrases.pCn: 正入射；垂直入射；法线入射
掠入射；切线入射；临界入射

remMethod.val: in(不， 无) ＋ cid(落下) ＋ ence → 苹果落下砸到牛顿的发生率并非那么高 → 发生率

words.tran: [光] 入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的
附带的；偶然的；容易发生的
附带事件；偶然事件；杂项

trans.tranOther: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect
